de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.controller.log
Interface Log

public interface Log

This interface is part of the logging mechanism and sets the name of the log file used to serialize exceptions.

Log folder
The class specifies the folder to store the logging file(s) and also defines the name of them.

Sequence of log files
Instead of using just one log file and reusing it over and over again we do it a little more sophisticated. Instead of overwriting useful information by one log file, a more effective way is possible. The logging API allows a sequence of files to hold log information. When a file fills up, the oldest file is emptied and logging resumes in that file.

Limiting the size
By default we limit the log file to a constant value. Remember, we use more log files, and each has the same limit.

Since:
May/05/09
Version:
0.1
Author:
Michael Munz

See Also:
Constant Field Values

LOG_FILE

static final java.lang.String LOG_FILE
name of the log file. A log file number is used to generated ranges from 0 to n-1 log files. When specifying the file name we need to include the location of the number using %g place holder. Each log file has a limit of x MB.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

LOG_FILE_LIMIT

static final int LOG_FILE_LIMIT
here is the log file limit specified.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

LOG_FILE_NO

static final int LOG_FILE_NO
we limit the size and use more than one log file as a rotating sequence. If the limit has been reached, the file is automatically emptied. However, this approach has drawbacks of discarding useful information. So we use a more effective way by allowing to use a sequence of files to hold the log information. When a file is filled up the oldest file is emptied and logging resumes in that file.
